website_summaries.verdict: This chainsaw is exceptionally powerful for a battery-powered model and is tough enough for even the most challenging tasks.
pros: Brushless motor design offers more torque and less vibration
Battery compatible with over 25 other Greenworks tools
Electronic chain brake prevents accidental kickbacks
cons: There have been some complaints of oil leaking out of the chainsaw

website_summaries.verdict: It's a powerful tool for a battery-operated model,  but you may be frustrated if you get one w/any of the known issues.
pros: A cordless model w/long battery life
Capable of handling up to 100 cuts or several hours of use
cons: A few reports of quality control issues and of "lemons."
Not quite as powerful as corded models

customer_reviews.title: If you’d like a saw where the chain falls off every 30 ...
customer_reviews.text: If you’d like a saw where the chain falls off every 30 seconds then this is the saw for you. Chain tensioner design is a joke. Ended up in the dumpster.
customer_reviews.author: Terri K.

customer_reviews.title: Happy to Sad
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty happy with this purchase until the chainsaw simply stopped working today, November 9th, and would not start up again. I cleaned it, re-adjusted the chain, put an additional charge on the battery and it simply did nothing. Shows that it has power but nothing happens when you try to start the saw. Seriously, it was easily cutting through a log when it just stopped mid-cut and no joy from that point on. I purchased it through Amazon and no option to return it is available. I bought it in September, used it for a grand total of about 20 hours and now it's useless. It was working perfectly before this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Vonnie D.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic tensioning mechanism.
customer_reviews.text: Saw worked great for what it is. This is for the homeowner with occasional use. Easily cut through 8-10" trees with no problem. The only problem is that the chain tensioner is plastic and the gear that it engages is also plastic. The teeth on the gear are now stripped making the saw useless. Product supposedly has a four year warranty, but I have been unable to get service so far
customer_reviews.author: Ed Rooney

customer_reviews.title: This saw never worked, Amazon replaced it, but ...
customer_reviews.text: This saw never worked, Amazon replaced it, but the 2nd saw did not work either, both had the same problem , no power to the switch. Called Greenworks but no help.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Driver

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: The first saw did not work because I did not push the battery down into its seat hard enough to make a good contact. I returned it. The second saw worked, but I had hard time to remove the battery from its seat. After a few tries I succeeded and the saw started to work. I had three successful cutting sessions. But then, during the next session, saw would not start. Overall, it is very flaky. I would not buy it again. After 10 charges, battery is dead
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Va'vra

customer_reviews.title: Chain sprocket poorly made and terrible customer support.
customer_reviews.text: The first couple times I used it loved it, but after a handful of uses the chain kicked off and now keeps kicking off. My take is it is poorly made and the sprocket that turns the chain bent or something shifted on it. I’ve had it for 2 months, thought it would hold up better than this. I’ve contacted customer support twice and they do not respond back. Disappointed, I own other products from them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Noegel

customer_reviews.title: Two years and going strong
customer_reviews.text: Been using this saw for two years including 100 hours clearing trail blowdowns caused by tornado damage in a local state park. I have been switching back and forth using 2 batteries and have been happy with how long they last. I have had zero mechanical or electrical issues and never had any chain oil leaks. Easy to replace or adjust chain without tools. Best features: 1. Pushbutton start. 2. Quieter - no ear protection needed. 3. No fumes. 4. No energy wasted idling. I don't plan to ever go back to a gas saw.
customer_reviews.author: Yassirreebob

customer_reviews.title: It's my new favorite chainsaw. Pros
customer_reviews.text: As light as my Echo 440CS but with much more power. Not as much power as my Husqvarna 450, but lighter and far cleaner/simpler to operate. It's my new favorite chainsaw. Pros: oil doesn't leak. Don't need ear pro. Light weight. Don't need a gas can. Battery lasts for a solid 60min+ of hard use. Essentially "off" when not pulling the trigger. Cons: batteries take a while to charge. Buy a second one (5.0amp-hr) and this isn't an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Torch

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed after 30 seconds of use
customer_reviews.text: Used for cutting small limbs on fruit trees less than 1.5" in diameter. Received the saw new. Charged battery to full capacity. Checked and adjusted chain tension to proper tension. Cut two limbs, on third limb chain came off and would not mount on chain bar. Problem diagnosed to three consecutive teeth having burring on drive teeth that prohibited them from entering guide slot on chain bar. I have a gas powered Echo saw I've been using for over 25 years so I have experience with chain saws and their proper usage and adjustment. Amazon promptly handled the return and refund. Great service.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Regretting this purchase. Leaks oil, lame battery.
customer_reviews.text: I read in some reviews this chainsaw leaks oil. That is a fact. Puddles of oil are collecting inside the chainsaw bag and have seeped through the bag ruining my car seat. Tried storing the chainsaw in its side and instead of coming out the bottom, it leaked out through the screw on cap. One person said the battery lasted him all day for an 8 hour day. Mine lasts for 25mins of use. If you're going to invest $200 in a chainsaw, this is not the one!
customer_reviews.author: MichaelRev1412

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Used for an hour or so over couple of weeks. Chain got dull very fast and cutting was VERY slow. Sharpened chain but cutting still very poor. Worse, Chain kept DERAILING. Tried tightening but began smoking. Tried loosening a bit and would then come off. Lubricant also leaks as many other reviewers note. VERY sorry I bought this. I'm trying to return for refund but missed the 30-day return window. I sent them messages via their website but no reply. I'll probably need to chuck this in garbage and chalk it up to experience.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Joel Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Product, No Warranty Support
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the battery chargers die after a few months, and the company does not honor their warranty. They do not even reply to emails about warranty service, and I was never able to reach their support department after several phone calls (I would be placed on hold, then after 10-15 minutes the call would abruptly disconnect). This indicates a real problem with the company IMO...and/or with their products. I was actually happy with the performance of the chainsaw. Just not with the company's lack of responsiveness and the failure of their charging units.
customer_reviews.author: T. Collins Logan

customer_reviews.title: Gobs of power.
customer_reviews.text: I've had other, smaller electric chainsaw's in the past, so I was tempering my expectations. But I needed a more powerful saw for this particular tree that fell on our property. Boy was I surprised. This saw easily cut through the 30" stump, with power to spare from the included 4mah battery. The box was heavily damaged during shipping, but everything in the box worked perfectly. The only glitch I discovered was that if the saw starts vibrating, the battery can pop loose. No... not a "Safety Feature".... but more like an inadequate latch to secure the battery into the saw. Other than that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: George Jardine

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  From gas to electric, I’ll never go back.
customer_reviews.text: From disbelief to endorsement in 5 days. When the box arrived and I picked it up, I was sure I was going to be disappointed as it was so light. A quick charge to top off the 4.0a battery and I took it to the wood pile. 30 Minutes later the work was done, I wasn’t tired, and the saw performed flawlessly. After a charge I was actually looking for things in my yard to cut. This is my second green works tool with the G-max battery so it also works on my pole trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Fataitaa

customer_reviews.title: Strangely Runs Backward
customer_reviews.text: I liked this saw a lot but then the saw actually began running backwards. I talked with customer service and they were great. They sent me a new saw. I used it twice and it ran fine. Yesterday guess what - I sit the saw down while moving limbs and when I restarted the saw it ran backwards. I went to the internet and from what I read it must be a clutch problem. At this point I wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: thomas owens

customer_reviews.title: Starts easy, no pulling or wishing you had a new spark plug.
customer_reviews.text: Most people have a gas saw or have had one at some point. This electric is both heavier and less powerful that it's comparable sized gas saw. This heavier electric also gets used while the gas saw sits....... Why? Because it starts and runs instantly for quick trims or jobs where you need to cut for a few min and them pick up pieces for a while. It cannot replace a gas saw for actual work or longevity. But quick trim jobs around the yard? It's the first thing I reach for.
customer_reviews.author: Just your average Justin

customer_reviews.title: Makes quick work of a cutting job
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Less noise, no smell. You will never go back to a burner saw. It is big and powerful enough to do serious work, yet light enough to not be fatiguing. It slobbers a little oil after use, but it is only the residue from the chain; the oil reservoir I filled to the top doesn't leak. No tool chain tightening is a plus. I bought the mower too and it paradoxically came with a 2Ah battery. I use this one in the saw because it is lighter and I usually just use the saw for clean-up. There are undoubtedly some downsides to this saw, but I just haven't found one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Alex F.

customer_reviews.title: First day and used one full battery charge. Run down..........
customer_reviews.text: 1. This thing is much safer IMO than a gas powered unit. 2. The battery life is extremely impressive. 3. It's quiet a/f compared to gas powered now for the bad: The chain has a habit of slipping off but that may go away after like my 3rd adjustment The chain also gets stuck more than a gas unit but that is probably a safety feature so you can call this one just an observation. The oil does go pretty quickly and it is is a tiny bit messy. Despite some of the minor negative things I can't think of a reason not to give it 5 stars because what it does good is pretty amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Hannibal

customer_reviews.title: I would like to preface this by saying I do like Greenworks ...
customer_reviews.text: I would like to preface this by saying I do like Greenworks products. I have a Lawn Mower, a Hedger, and two Edgers. However when it comes to this chain saw. I ordered it and it was never delivered at first until Amazon gave me a replacement. I was going to buy an 18 inch with 80 V but I used this one the past weekend, during the first cut the chain came out. I literally had to fix the chain after every cut and I think I will return altogether. This has been a disappointment given how much I enjoy my other Greenworks tools.
customer_reviews.author: JLP

customer_reviews.title: Spits the chain way to easy!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this chainsaw, but it's letting me down. I have a really overgrown shrub in my back yard that I need a chainsaw to cut back the overgrowth. Limbs about as big around as a soda can. The darn chain keeps coming off. I've used chainsaws for over thirty years. I know how tight chain should be. It's really frustrating. I love all the other greenworks 40 volt tools I have, but this one has let me down.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Senior Citizens take note!
customer_reviews.text: For those of us with high mileage bodies that need a chainsaw a couple of times a year an you are having trouble starting you gas saw, take my advise. Sell or give away all of your gas powered chainsaws, I had 3, but never again in this life! Working for about a hour, I cleared out a patch of small trees & brush--2 to 6 inches. I needed a break an checked battery life. I had used only 25% . I was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D.

customer_reviews.title: Good chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 of the Greenworks products. I really became interested in the Lawn Mower and then started picking up additional tools as needed. The Chainsaw is powerful and it cuts through anything that I have put it on. I have had a slight problem with the chain coming off while cutting, but it is easy to re-install and there is a tightening knob on it that makes it easy to adjust tension. If you are tired of Oil and Gas chainsaws, cleaning carburetors or pull starts; these products are durable and do the job. I have owned the Lawn mower for a number of years and never had to worry about it not starting. That alone is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: I like all of them
customer_reviews.text: This Greenworks saw works very well, although it could use more power. I own 4 Greenworks cordless outdoor tools; chainsaw,HD trimmer, blower, and hedge trimmer. I like all of them. They all need more power. They are quiet, convenient, efficient, I own 2 chargers and 2 batteries so while using one of power tools the 2nd battery is charging. I opted for the larger batteries; they are heavier but they last longer. Consumer Reports rated the Greenworks line as good but there were a couple of manufacturers which had a surperior rating.
customer_reviews.author: JWHow

customer_reviews.title: Works well, feels safe
customer_reviews.text: I used it to cut up some pecan wood from a down tree. It worked well for me and feels safe. The chainsaw is so quiet and barely vibrates making it much more comfortable to use than gas. I didn't use the full 4ah battery in 30 mins but I wouo want to be stuck without power if I were a pro. It may be great value for homeowners but the batteries are very expensive if you need lasting power. The batteries become so hot from running tools that they will not charge until they cool off.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lemak

customer_reviews.title: Really Underpowered
customer_reviews.text: Just attacked the dead Oak in my front yard (about 14" in diameter). First real test of the saw. Made it through cutting the tree down, and 2 log cuts before the fully charged battery went flat. The saw really struggled to cut the oak at all-- just way underpowered. Supposed to be able to cut a whole cord of wood on a charge-- not even close. Overall, this is useful only to cut branches and other minor yard tasks-- you are going to need a gas powered saw if you have anything significant to do. Other issues-- the blade also really does not want to stay on, and the battery is surprisingly hard to remove from the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Another Customer127

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be redesigned, not worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and it could be a great product but you have to put the chain back on every 5 minutes. They attempted to design an easy way to tighten the chain but it loosens way to easily while in use. NOT worth buying. I sent an email to the company and they ignored me. It is now just a big paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hur

customer_reviews.title: Chainsaw does not fit product description
customer_reviews.text: How disappointing that the Greenworks 40V Chainsaw that I received from you does not fit your product description. YourProduct Description says "this chainsaw features a heavy duty Oregon bar and chain, .0375 chain pitch, chain brake, metal bucking spikes and an automatic oiler" It does not have an Oregon bar and chain and no metal bucking spikes. The owners manual does not even speak about an "automatic oiler." How can I exchange this new, never used saw for one that fits the description?
customer_reviews.author: diane buchholz

customer_reviews.title: Push a button, it wokrs
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 Greenworks tools at the same time, and I'm posting pretty much the same review for all of them. This isn't the tool to take for a day in the woods, but it does the small to medium size job around the house. Battery needs charging more often than I would like Perhaps I'll buy another battery. Chain oil reservoir seems a bit small, I need to keep an eye on it. I'm so tired of messing with 2 cycle gas engines. I started buying expensive premixed gas with no ethanol. Maybe the price of premixed gas justifies buying additional batteries. I'm wondering how this will perform in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Mite
customer_reviews.text: I have over 4 acres of mostly oak around our house. I have used this mighty mite to cut small trees, branches, softwood scrub trees and bushes. I’ve used it one handed to cut limbs that floated in the spring rains and were wedged under our bridge across the creek causing quite a blockage. I’ve cut oak 8 inches thick. The battery lasts a long time between charges. An hour of actual cutting is a lot of cutting because you’re not using the battery when you release the trigger.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J.

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with all my Greenworks tools.
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw for brush and small tree removal. Just charge a battery, add some chain oil and go. No gas and oil mixing, or the noise. Don't expect it to do what a gas saw will do because it won't. They do leak chain oil so just fill enough to do the cutting you want to do. I like to store both my Greenworks saws bar facing down in a 5 gallon bucket. This way when they do leak the oil goes down into the chain guard or the bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W Wright

customer_reviews.title: This oil leak problem has no solutions?
customer_reviews.text: first use after delivery was great, smooth and not as noisy as my other chainsaws, well, 2nd use was not so, chain ran out of the track and a kickback, when trying to put the chain back, yes, oil all over when turning the handle up, sideways, horizontal, I read about this infamous oil leak problem in reviews before I order the product, loosen up the vacuum cap a bit as a precaution to release the pressure, still, oil leaks all over. This oil problem has no solutions?
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Suprised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw to do light trimming around to house. I have been surprised at the torque compared to a gas saw of similar size. The battery life was also better than I expected. The saw does have some built in protection that will keep you from over torquing the saw and overheating and damaging the battery. This is a great option if you do not want to deal with the fuss of internal combustion two stroke engines and all of their problems. Just drop in the battery and switch on the saw. This is my second Greenworks product and I am pleased with both purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde H. Allen, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SAW!!!
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is awesome. I needed to purchase a saw to clear some fallen eucalyptus trees on the MIL’s property. I was researching gas saws when I came across the Greenworks saw. Based on the large amount of positive reviews, I bought the saw and a second battery (Shentec 5ah). I absolutely love this thing. It cuts as well as any gas saw I’ve used in the past...just keep the chain sharp (duh) and it will be a delightful saw to use. Like others have said, it does leak oil. That is a downfall, but bar oil is cheap and I keep it in the shed, so who cares about a little spilled oil?
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical...especially when the saw blade bounced lightly on top of the first log I cut...then with a little pressure it really went to work. It is light and requires you to push but it cuts great for the type of jobs I need it for. The log in the pics took 1.5 batteries. You want another battery...I went with the cheapest one I could find on Amazon. This thing is so much easier than my gasoline chainsaw. I’m very happy with this chainsaw!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THRILLED!!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this almost one year. Have taken down about 15 trees. Many branches. Easily has cut anything I have wanted it to cut. Probably 12" round is the thickest tree I have cut. I know it could do even thicker. Have not changed or sharpened the chain yet. Chain has not come off while cutting. Easy to tighten when it does come loose. So much quieter than a gas powered chain saw. No issues with oil leaking. I will never go back to gas. So much easier to use and maintain. Battery will easily last at least an hour. Very happy with the power. Totally recommend this product for any home owner.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Surprising little saw
customer_reviews.text: One of the things I hate most in this world is the sound of small 2-stroke engines. With this in mind I purchased the 40 volt 16" electric saw - but didn't really expect too much. Surprise! I just finished cutting up a large tree branch, about 12" - 14" that had fallen on my roof and yard. I still have two bars of battery left, and I cut that branch into a dozen pieces, plus trimmed it. Quiet, surprisingly long battery life and impressive power. Hmm, I see they have numerous other gizmos that work ont he same battery pack too.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 74 year old hubby because getting the gas one started was becoming heart attach material at his age. This saw is so easy to start and light enough that even I can use it! We spent 6 hours cleaning up fallen branches from the winter and had to quit before the battery even ran out. Sure made the job a lot easier and loved how this saw is to able to be maneuvered around some of the bigger piles of tree limbs. Great saw and looking at getting their pole saw w/hedge trimmer next to replace a few more tools that weigh a ton and are hard to start.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Guru

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new property in the country and had two down trees in an area that was meant to be clear (not woods). Instead of paying a local service $1000 to clear the trees, I had at them with this chainsaw. Took about 3 weekends, but completely cleared, and I've got a nice pile of wood drying out for next winter to use in our stoves. Chainsaw is still working well, but as other reviewed have noted, it does leak oil. Be sure to store with some plastic underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Sands7

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast......
customer_reviews.text: Works just as great as the snowblower I bought from them two years ago. Unlike other reviews mine DOES NOT LEAK oil, but not supposed to store for long periods with full of oil anyway. I just get some residual (and very small) from what was left on the chain. Has cut anything that my gas powered chain saw cut before it went bad. Plus, it's nice to be able to put it down and enjoy the quiet unlike a gas powered saw that you would either have to let idle or shut of and re start over and over. This brand of battery powered tools seem to work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Shaeffer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after about 30 minutes of use * updated *
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw was for my father who can't pull start a gas chainsaw anymore. I ordered it for him and he used it twice before it stopped functioning. The battery is fully charged per the lights on the battery, Green light lite, when he presses the trigger nothing. He has spent 2 hours on the phone, 1 hour was waiting in queue. Once he got a hold of someone they are questioning if it's used or not. As of now I will not be buying a replacement from the same company. ** Update ** after emailing all the purchase information to the company they sent a replacement chain saw out directly.
customer_reviews.author: Dtalbert

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this saw a few times now. I like not worrying about having to start it. Battery does not last as long as I would like. May need to purchase another in the future. Battery charge time seems a bit long as well. Love how quiet it is! 3/4 tank of chain oil per battery charge. Yes. You can put the chain on backwards! First time using it, the chain came off, twice. Have not had an issue with chain since. Overall, I enjoy using it. No regrets!
customer_reviews.author: T.S.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY CHAINSAW!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a chainsaw before as I always thought I would end up cutting my leg off or something! I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to use. And it was much more powerful than I thought it would be! I figured a battery-powered chainsaw would be quite weak in cutting ability, but boy was I ever wrong! It was also very quiet as opposed to gas powered chainsaws. I had a blast cutting down trees with this! Truth be told, I gave out way before the battery did. I was shocked to see that I was a lemon to do all the cutting I needed and still have battery power left over.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wisener

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings.....
customer_reviews.text: this is my husband's chainsaw. He writes...."Love the saw itself.......not heavy, cuts good. But the battery is junk. The battery is supposed to last the amount of time you can cut 140 4 X 4's. I have access to scrap 4 X 4's and did a test. I cut only 47 4 X 4's when my battery died. The first four times I used the saw the battery lasted approximately 40, 45, 25 and 20 minutes. To be fair I call Greenworks and they have sent me a new battery. I haven't gotten it as of the day I write this review, so it remains to be seen if the new battery is better than the original."
customer_reviews.author: natalie

customer_reviews.title: Must buy if your looking for battery powered chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Great battery powered chainsaw. Store chainsaw laying on side opposite of blade to avoid oil leak or draining oil after using. Battery life is very good to great. You will be tired before having to change battery. This is with the 4000 ah battery included. Buy the Epowon 5000mAh Replacement Greenworks G-MAX 40V Lithium Battery. It is a fraction of the cost of the Greenworks branded battery at a fraction of the cost. Battery life is exceptional and last just as long as branded battery.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great value, cuts as well as any gas chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this chainsaw for a year now. Better than my gas chainsaw that I gave away because I will not used another gas saw after my experience with this chainsaw. Cuts as fast, plenty of power and best thing is that it’s quiet, no more gas or pollution.
customer_reviews.author: Bttrby

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to use chain saw bar oil. Regular motor oil has the wrong viscosity.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Greenworks 16-Inch 40V 16 Chainsaw to prune large limbs on apple trees and cut downed trees. This saw performs just as good as my old Poulan 16 in gas saw. Only better. Because there is no struggling to get started due gas saw sitting for a year. Even though I use Non ethanol fuel. Note if Greenworks fails to operate during use. Check the kick back safety. During use I engaged the safety without realizing and thought it had failed. Clicked Kick back guard back to run. I was back to work. I would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Roy Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not turning on off the box!
customer_reviews.text: Was never able to turn it on. Customer service is open on weekdays EST, which is very inconvenient. My return window with Amazon has passed. I have a greenworks eco system and now I regret it. The piece I got is junk!
customer_reviews.author: Saravana Sigamani

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good battery power chain saw. I think it is made more for trimming thicker branches/cutting up smaller trees. It will work on thicker trees, but you just got to have some patience. The chain isn't too bad to put on. I would recommend buying a second battery if you have a huge job to do, as my first one lasted about an hour or so. The chain life isn't too bad, but again, if you have a huge job, I'd recommend getting a 2nd chain. Overall, for a battery power saw, I think it was worth the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Styles1333

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: My 74 year old husband has used this to cut down about 25 fir trees that were at least. 30 feet tall and trimmed and cut them up. He has nothing but good things to say about this saw. A replace the chain was inexpensive and went on easily too. One tree was in the power lines so he had to use a ladder to cut the branches around the wires and it was light enough for him to use to do this
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lousy
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly sure how this product has almost a 5 star review. The chainsaw cuts well when it is charged up, but the issue is the battery lasts for a solid 3 minutes of actual cutting time per charge. Maybe I just have a defunct battery but this is insane. Would take me a full week to cut down and cut up a 10 foot tree with a 8 inch diameter. Luckily my neighbor supplied me with a $40 electric chain saw that did the job. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki

customer_reviews.title: GreenWorks Chain Saw Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chainsaw as I am disabled and can't pull a regular saw cord. I don't feel like I want to rip my guts out pulling on a starter cord nor have to deal with oil and gas, etc. This saw surely does the job and it really saws through limbs like butter. The only con I feel is worth writing about is the weight. It's a bit on the heavy side and since I'm disabled, I was trying to find a saw that was a bit lighter. That is my only complaint. Otherwise, this saw is great, does the job and works well with even the toughest wood jobs. I would recommend this to any outdoorsman.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A QUALITY ITEM - IT WORKS WELL
customer_reviews.text: YES THE CHAIN DOES COME OFF, I DON'T OVER OIL IT, IF YOU CAN KEEP YOUR CUT STRAIT, NO PROBLEM. THE THING IS THE CHAIN IS SO EASY TO PUT BACK ON, IT'S NO BIG DEAL. I CUT A GREEN 18" CYPRESS BRANCH WITH THE 16" SAW WITH EASE. AFTER 3 WEEKS OF HEAVY USE THE CHAIN HAS COME OFF 5 TIMES, IT TAKES 3 MINUTES TO PUT IT BACK ON, BUT IT STILL GOING STRONG. IT'S QUIET, THE BATTERY LASTS FOR HOURS AND CHARGES QUICKLY (OVER LUNCH). A GREAT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: MAX HAMMER

customer_reviews.title: Great 16” saw
customer_reviews.text: The saw came ready to use; no assembly, just add oil and charge battery. I did plenty of cutting on a single charge. I’ve read of issues with oil leakage and chain coming off. I had almost no leakage. The chain did come off one time, but it will naturally stretch when used heavily on first use, and I didn’t check it. I’ve had no issues since and the tightening is simple with no wrenches. The speed of the chain is very good. The 40v battery does make it somewhat heavy, but not unwieldy.
customer_reviews.author: Buck W

customer_reviews.title: Nice utility Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a Cottage on Lake Michigan. Woods of Pine, Oak, Basswood, Cottonwood, Choke Cherry and Elm. Trees don't schedule when they are going to fall. And they always find the driveway. This saw probably cuts at 85% of a gas saw. But cordless, no oil/gas mix needed, low vibration and noise makes this easy to grab. Just cut up a 15 to 18" fresh fallen wet pine. Takes a bit longer to cut up than gas. But I had everything I needed to get the job started now and get it done quick. A great utility saw.
customer_reviews.author: Alan C Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Too dangerous to use
customer_reviews.text: After adjusting the saw per instructions I tried to use it for the first time, I filled the bar and chain oil reservoir, tried to cut a branch, the chain jumped off the bar. I put the chain back on and adjusted it per instructions again, when I tried the first cut the chain jumped off again. This happened 5 times the last time the chain hit my hand. I put the saw away, it is too dangerous to use. I would like to return the saw for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: DBaird

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for homeowners.
customer_reviews.text: The perfect chainsaw for the average homeowner. The gas never goes bad, no oil to measure, starts right up. More than enough power and battery life to be get er done. The stack in the photo, was from the first usage, on the initial battery charge. Loved my Husqvarna Rancher to clear the lot, that was 16 years ago, and a torn rotator cuff ago, this is more suitable now.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Brandauer

customer_reviews.title: Great Job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to work around my yard to cut small trees and clean up debris. The saw does a great job of cutting pine trees as well as 6-inch hardwood trees. Saw has a handguard but not a hand brake. The saw is easy to maneuver and easy to use. Compared to gas saws this saw is very quiet, which allows you to hear what is going on around you while you are working. For regular lightweight work and the occasional medium size job, this is a very good saw for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chain falls off
customer_reviews.text: Thought, hoped it would be a good product. Tired of gas chainsaws being hard to start.Shoulder not getting younger. The battery holds a charge well. It cuts as good as a gas saw when the chain stays on .It comes off the track frequently. It is properly tightened and I haven't had that problem with my Husqvarna. It can be very frustrating when trying to complete a project so good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: This battery operated tool is superior to all of the others that I have owned or operated. I ran the saw the first day that I received it for one hour and did not experience any reduction in power at the end. Other saws would start to die after twenty minutes. No more two cycle for me. Add bar/chain oil, pull the trigger and away we go. Easy chain tension adjustment, has kick back safety bar.
customer_reviews.author: tilly

customer_reviews.title: This is solidly constructed and works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Greenworks chainsaw that I have owned. My first was the smaller model which I keep in my truck (I use an inverter to keep the battery charged) for those times I'm out and need to clear some branches or small trees from the road. I liked it so much that I bought the larger one for use around my house. No more loud noises and gasoline smells for me!
customer_reviews.author: Fred E

customer_reviews.title: I love this saw
customer_reviews.text: I own several chainsaws, but now the one I pick up to use most often is this one. If I'm working all day, I have a gasoline saw for that. But 90% of the jobs around my yard are small and the battery is more than enough to get the job done. Keep your chain sharp, keep the bar oiled, and you won't have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: G. M. Waid

customer_reviews.title: A terrific addition to my property-maintenance arsenal
customer_reviews.text: A terrific addition to my property-maintenance arsenal. Handles much larger cutting jobs than I though it would be capable of and it keeps on ticking. Much easier (and cleaner) to use than a gas-powered machine and I would think that unless you have regular heavy-duty sawing jobs then this machine should be more than adequate. A single charge of the large 40V battery is good for 20-45 min of continuous cutting. Keep the chain oiled and consider getting a 2nd battery to get it performing its best.
customer_reviews.author: Martin L.

customer_reviews.title: Battery life span is low
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw is powerful, how ever the battery is bad. The warranty time is increased to 3 years but will not cover the any item purchased before 2020. When you call the customer service, you have to wait for 2 hours. There are more than a hundred calls ahead of you. THIS COMPANY SHOULD LOW THE BATTERY PRICE OR OFFER MORE WARRANTY TIME FOR HOME USING CUSTOMERS.
customer_reviews.author: Andyrong

customer_reviews.title: GreenWorks 20312 G-Max 40V 16-In Cordless Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after reading the reviews. This was absolutely perfect for me. I had a big oak trimmed in my yard and had many 8-12 inch diameter sections to cut up. This chain saw cut them with ease. I did not want the hassle of a gas saw as I have infrequent needs for a saw, usually only if I have broken limbs or oversize firewood. Love the weight and quiet operation. For people with similar needs, this is the perfect solution. Reviews said saw leaks so I drained it after use and stored it in handy supplied bag. Battery stayed charged for the whole job.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Duggan

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good battery powered electric chainsaw. I gave it 5 stars because it did what I needed it to do - which was cut up a pretty big fallen tree that fell behind my chicken coop. It's easy to operate, and the instructions are very clear. The base of the trunk was probably close to 4ft in circumference. If you're cutting bigger, I'd say get something with more power, though this saw is capable. I'm just not too sure how it will do since I wont probably ever need it for something bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Pikato

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it from Amazon! Part two...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two from Amazon within a weeks time. The switch on both would not work. Greenworks suggested purchasing directly from them. Same price and free shipping. Overall Rating is Zero. Third time the charm. Saw powers up. We'll see how it cuts when it stops snowing and raining.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty good. The only issue I might have is ...
customer_reviews.text: Gone through 2 battery cycles and a couple of trees so far. No complaints. It works pretty good. The only issue I might have is that the chain keeps coming off. Any slight twist on the blade and the chain pops off. Might be operator error though. I never used a small saw like this in the past, so it could be me. I am used to 24" blades. Getting older and just need something to keep the yard cleaned up now days. This meets that goal.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: The chain will not stain on!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had zero issues with other Greenworks products, but this chainsaw is awful. The chain came off 3x in less than an hour while cutting small branches. I spent more time putting it back on than actually cutting. I am sending it back. I’ve had a smaller Black & Decker chainsaw for 5 years and only replaced one chain, but needed a larger saw.
customer_reviews.author: Keb

customer_reviews.title: Decent but problems
customer_reviews.text: This is a good chainsaw and I got it on sale, so I'm happy with it. However, a few reviewers mentioned a leaking chain oil reservoir and they were spot on. The saw itself works fine and I've used it pretty heavily for a month, but the chain oil leaks constantly when the tool is stored. Fix this issue, and you've got a 5-star saw.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Tobias

customer_reviews.title: Great saw! Starts every time.
customer_reviews.text: I took this to my hunting lease yesterday and I am so glad I did. I was almost to my stand when I came on an 8" dead pine blocking the road. It also had fallen into two other smaller trees and had bent them over into the road. I used my Greenworks pole saw to clear the smaller trees up high and my Greenworks chain saw to cut up the big tree so I could move it. The best part was the saws started right up. I HATE pulling on a two stroke engine that won't start. The batteries last a long time and are easy to charge. I would definitely recommend this to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Good for smaller trees!
customer_reviews.text: This thing does exactly what it needs to - within reason. I was in need of a saw that could tackle some smaller trees and larger overgrown bushes and it did it just fine. Battery life tends to be pretty decent. I wouldn't recommend this saw for large tree's though. I noticed that once I tried to tackle the branches or a trunk that was over 12in in circumference, the saw ate through batteries like crazy. It also took a while to get through the cutting. I used this on pine and maple thus far - so it works alright on soft and hard woods.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight convenient to use
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great easy to use lightweight, quiet, easy to use and maintain. Granted it doesn't rip through a log like my gas powered Husqvarna but it cuts through nice and I find at the end of the day I get more logs done with the electric because I can cut for a longer time due to less fatigue. Battery power is not an issue for me because I have the lawn mower. I have three batteries so by the time I drain one I have another one charged
customer_reviews.author: rich

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical on buying a battery powered chainsaw. Read a ton of reviews and watched videos on you tube. I think the reviews won me over with Greenworks. I didn't need a 16" bar but wanted the brushless motor and the bigger battery. The saw came quicker than expected. I had a white oak to trim and was just hoping to have enough charge to get the branches on the ground and I'd recharge the battery when I got on the ground. Not only did I get the branches down, I got everything cut up and stacked. I'm going to buy the trimmer now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: If you have wood to cut infrequently, this item may work OK for you... but, please note it is NOT high-quality or manufactured to endure everyday use. In my case, the chain comes off the bar every time I use. I am constantly having to place the chain back on the bar and re-tension it. I know how to use a chain saw. I bought this for occasional use around the yard... NOT useful out in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: michael floyd

customer_reviews.title: It’s a little powerhouse of cutting power!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! This chainsaw is amazing! I was skeptical. I admit. A battery run chainsaw??? No way. Yes way! Just cut up a downed tree in the yard that was about 10” diameter. This little pro saves me from the pain of mixing gas, TRYING to get the pull start engaged, adjusting the choke and keeping it running long enough to touch the tree. EASY. Went through it like a hot knife through butter! Battery still had enough charge to do additional work. Wouldn’t be a bad idea to purchase an extra battery. To swap Out. Well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Ike LaRue

customer_reviews.title: Best Saint Patrick's Day Present EVER
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more positive about this chainsaw if the company were paying me. The battery charges fast and lasts as long as I do. I can fell a 60~70 foot tree and chop the whole thing into 16" firewood and the battery is still showing one bar. I am completely amazed. No gas, pulling starter cord, fouled plugs, carbon crud, or extension cords. Let it sit in the garage as long as you want, then pull it out and get to work in 5 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth B. Sizer II

customer_reviews.title: I didn't think a battery chainsaw was a good idea.
customer_reviews.text: Boy was I wrong! It cuts big hardwood just like it's 2 stroke cousins! Works great and surprisingly quiet. The battery doesn't last that long but it does a great job on small jobs like trimming those pesky softwood trees that keep popping up every year. No more mixing gas and oil for me! I wood recommend this to anyone with a lot of small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: I love this chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I have waited this long to write a review, because I wanted to make sure the equipment continued to work. I use it 2 or 3 times a week and it is still cutting perfectly. I went ahead and ordered a replacement chain because I knew this chainsaw was a keeper. I do not have the oil leak that some others had a problem with. maybe they addressed that problem. I have two gas powered chainsaws, but this electric one is usually the first one i pick up when i go to work.
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: DIDN'T EXPECT MUCH!
customer_reviews.text: The saw far exceeded my expectations to date. Side by side test with gas saw yeilds same results without at the gas/starting/frustration BS! Easy to use . . . long battery life. I'm a happy camper to date. Time will be the ultimate test, but with gas at $4.00 a gallon [or $7.00 a quart for specialty fuel] I can throw the battery SOB out after trimming my olive orchard . . . . Calif gas with all it's additives kills small gas engines. I have to take my gas saws in to be rebuilt every year because Calif gas kills all plastic parts and hoses. $75 a pop to repair. I can buy alot of batteries for that!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Norman

customer_reviews.title: better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I have not had much luck with chainsaws. They are hassle. I have a 1 acre yard and its overgrown so I needed something that would work. This thing rocks. By the time the battery runs out - so have I. Time for a break. I have cut down about 20 acacia trees with it over the past 6 weeks - cut them up[ and put through chipper. Great success.
customer_reviews.author: David Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Saw
customer_reviews.text: I make frequent use of chainsaws and own 4 including a large Sthil. This is the "go-to" saw I carry in the RTV when I drive the trails around our 230 acres. Instant on & instant off, just a matter of pushing a button and pulling the trigger. Plenty of power, cuts everything I've needed to cut with it and with a spare battery I literally never run out of power. If for some reason I couldn't get fuel (storm, etc.) I could charge this with a solar panel and never worry. Like any chainsaw, sharpen the chain frequently for the best cuts. BTW, this saw was recommended to me by a professional logger.
customer_reviews.author: D.S.

customer_reviews.title: it is a good chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: definitely on par with mid/light end gas powered chainsaw, a charged battery lasts longer then a tank of gas on my last chainsaw, an older 41cc husqvarna hopefully the future holds cheaper batteries in store, that seems to be the only real drawback, i would honestly recommend the chainsaw, but if you cut a lot of firewood you may want to aim for a good gas powered chainsaw just for the simple fact that this is electronic, you might not want to be outside cutting wood in rain or snow. side note: lithium batteries are said to have a shelf life of about 5 years so if you can try to get newer batteries
customer_reviews.author: random spaz 219

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for older person
customer_reviews.text: I am 83 years old The chain saw is easy to use and it cuts very well I have gas operated saws but they are hard to start. The battery power is much more suited for a man of my age
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was suspicious of battery operated chainsaws, but can no longer pull the cord on my gas ones, cuts better than expected, battery actually lasts longer than expected, will need to get a couple more batteries, you have to let the battery cool down before charging and takes 2 hours to fully charge. I use it to cut firewood and trim logs before putting them on my sawmill. trimmed some good sized ones without any hesitation, went right thru them
customer_reviews.author: James Beckstine

customer_reviews.title: Chain Falls Off
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for this chainsaw but it is a disappointment to say the least. Not even five minutes after using it the chain fell off, put it back on, 2 minutes later the chain fell off, put it back on..yep..the chain fell off. No matter what tension I use, the chain will not stay on making this chainsaw worthless!
customer_reviews.author: Linda D.

customer_reviews.title: Glad we bought this!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in January to use on our goat farm. Initially, my husband was thinking of having this lighter weight saw for me to use and he would continue to use the Stihl farm boss chainsaw. Well he likes this one so well I have not used it yet and the Stihl has only been used once since receiving this Greenworks Chainsaw. As others have reviewed the battery typically holds out as long as the user. We would definitely recommend this chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Great for firewood, but eh for bigger trees
customer_reviews.text: This thing will cut, and it’ll cut great...but it’s no gas chainsaw. Any tree under 10 inches in diameter is easy to cut with this, but get any bigger than that and it starts to struggle. Not a big deal for me, since I’m mainly cutting small trees for firewood. The battery life is pretty good...a lot better than I was expecting. I can usually cut for about 30 minutes before before the battery runs out. Biggest plus...you can use this and not reek of gas afterwards!!
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: Love this chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time instead of my gas chainsaw when I have smaller jobs and even when I have some medium sized logs to cut through. I've used it up to 16-18" logs and it's done very well. It is so convenient. I doubt battery will ever replace my gas saw, but love having this thing around and find it's often the one I grab first.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty42

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Bought this chainsaw for pruning fruit trees, but after a fallen 60-foot pine tree blocked the road, I had to put it to use. It was -12*F that morning, and my much more expensive gas-powered chainsaw wouldn’t start. The Greenworks saw didn’t have any problems at all. The 16” bar handled all but the very trunk of the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Salem

customer_reviews.title: Cutting-edge technology and performance...
customer_reviews.text: Until this saw, I had used nothing but gas-powered saws and believed that nothing would beat them for the tough jobs. I was wrong and I must say that I'm very happy that I gave this saw a chance. The battery lasted through most of a large pine that had fallen in our backyard before needing a charge, and the overall maintenance is so simple. I'll probably never go back to the gas-powered tools for the household jobs that I do.
customer_reviews.author: DMStubbs

customer_reviews.title: Said
customer_reviews.text: Loved my first experience w/ this . Cuts & maneuvers amazingly well. As I was doing art sculpting these weren’t necessarily straight cuts . It cut smoother w/ better control than a traditional chain saw , but not lacking power or cut . My only concern is the battery didn’t seem to last the projected battery time , but I could be mistaken there ( Manual is put away ) . Larger batteries than what it comes with are available & in fairness I was cutting on a couple of large hard pack stumps .
customer_reviews.author: Glenneth Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Good company, solid products
customer_reviews.text: Could not be any happier with this purchase. Cuts nice and smooth with little vibration and the battery gives you time get well into a project before changing. I also own the Greenworks pole trimmer and hedge trimmer. I think in general these tools are well-made and backed by a company who wants to be a leader in the industry. Many of the reviews say the company worked with them when problems occurred. I will not hesitate to buy Greenworks products in the future. I'm considering the GW 12" chainsaw; since I already own 2 40v batteries, 57 bucks is pretty much a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bodine

customer_reviews.title: Immediately Broke
customer_reviews.text: I charged the battery and then plugged it into the chainsaw and the on-light got stuck on and wouldn't turn off. Despite being on it wouldn't actually work. If it breaks so easily I couldn't imagine it holding up in the long run. Returned its and going to get a Makita chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C

customer_reviews.title: Chain keeps falling off
customer_reviews.text: We decided to get a small chainsaw for ivy and low branches, but this one is not well made. I thought about $250 would get us a decent saw, but the chain has come off every time we've used it. It's annoying, as he has to stop and put it back on, which can take 10 to 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen S.

customer_reviews.title: low power
customer_reviews.text: I have had a craftsman battery operated chain saw for over 10 years. That saw was a 12" and this one was 16". The power on the smaller saw was double or triple the power on this greenworks model. Also the battery life on the Craftsman and recharging time were both far better. I no longer own a gas powered garden item to include a lawn mower. All my battery operated tools and lawn equipment exceeded my expectations--this one was not able to make even 2 full cuts on a spruce 16" dia tree that fell before the battery was done.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Schindler

customer_reviews.title: I’m impressed!!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t expecting much.... pretty much figured I was buying a toy, but needed a battery powered saw. This is really awesome. Just as fast as a gas saw, but obviously it doesn’t run as long. Good enough for the work I need though. As a test, I did cut through a downed pine tree that was about 20” in diameter. Fully charged, I made it through 7-8 full cut-throughs. Not bad considering it’s not built for that.

customer_reviews.title: Can I give 0 stars?
customer_reviews.text: Product never worked from day one. After messing with chain will turn on for about 10 seconds, shuts off, and starts beeping. Piece of junk and doesn't work at all! Couldn't even get a small tree chopped down. Just submitted for a return.
customer_reviews.author: William Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: unexpected
customer_reviews.text: i never thought a battery chain saw would run sowwwww sosososo well. lots of power and run time. i read a review that said this saw leaked oil, not mine though. i do need a grease syringe not sold with saw. this is an item amazon could recommend to keep product in top running order.
customer_reviews.author: john m.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product! If your wondering if you should buy this dont second guess yourself.
customer_reviews.text: I have cut down enough trees in the past two week to make a burn pile 15'x20' and 8 feet tall. The battery last about 50 minutes before it needs a recharge which is plenty of time, by that time im ready for a drink and a short break...so i get a drink, refill the chain oil and swap for a battery and get to work. This chainsaw suprised me how well it works. I would recommend to a friend 😁
customer_reviews.author: Tristen Shuptrine

customer_reviews.title: decent item
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, but just because it has a 16" bar does not mean it can handle large logs. Saw works great for cutting logs/branches up to 4-5 inches diameter, above that it struggles. It will do the job but you might want a gas saw to compliment this one for larger cuts. Almost no vibration and very quiet (compared to a gas saw) makes this a worthy item when cutting in a neighborhood. Overall I am happy with this item, but disappointed because I have to get a gas saw for those larger cuts. This will do most of my yard work, but not all.
customer_reviews.author: trevor

product_meta.title: Greenworks G-MAX 40V 16-Inch Cordless Chainsaw, 4AH Battery and a Charger Included 20312
product_meta.description:
Size:4Ah Battery and Charger| Style:Old Style| Pattern Name:ChainsawWe are taking our Lithium-Ion technology to the next level and giving you the gas comparable alternative chainsaw solution you have been looking for with up to 30% more torque and up to 70% less vibration than gas powered chainsaws. GreenWorks NEW G-MAX 16-inch DigiPro Chainsaw is powered with our innovative brushless technology allowing for longer life, greater efficiency and less noise with more torque--making this the first battery powered chainsaw that can replace your gas. The perfect chainsaw for users of all experience, whether it is your first time or a veteran this chainsaw features a heavy duty Oregon bar and chain, .0375 chain pitch, chain brake, metal bucking spikes and an automatic oiler to make this easy to use while providing the high performance needed to get your yard work done quickly and efficiently. Once you have tried our NEW DigiPro Chainsaw you will not want to go back to mixing gas and oil. Our NEW DigiPro Brushless System will offer gas comparable performance lawn tools for the serious lawn care enthusiast.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
We are taking our Lithium-Ion technology to the next level and giving you the gas comparable alternative chainsaw solution you have been looking for. Make your life easier with this cordless GreenWorks DigiPro G-MAX 16-inch Chainsaw. The innovative brushless motor technology provides up to 80% longer life and up to 30% more torque, it also creates less noise and lower vibration for user comfort--making this the first battery powered chainsaw that can replace your old gas chainsaw. This is the perfect chainsaw for users of all experience, whether it is your first time or a veteran, you can get started within seconds compared to the hard to manage pull cords, the mixing of oil and gas, the fumes and the mess. Featuring a heavy duty 16-inch Oregon bar and chain, .0375 chain pitch, safety chain brake, metal bucking spikes and an automatic oiler, you will find the torque and durability of this chainsaw to meet your expectations. And whether it’s chores around the home or natural disaster clean up, our G-MAX 40V Lithium-Ion System will make your life easier. Once you have tried this DigiPro Chainsaw you will not want to go back to mixing gas and oil. Available with a G-MAX 40V 4ah Li-Ion Battery or Tool Only, the G-MAX System is compatible with 14 different lawn tools to offer a complete yard work solution for the serious lawn care home owner. When looking for the right gas comparable lawn tools, GreenWorks G-MAX System is the right solution to turn to with the power and performance, longer run time and versatility to get the job done.
feature_bullets: Our Greenworks Brushless motor provides your Greenworks tool with longer run-time, more torque and more power. This leads to less wear and tear, extending the life-time of the tool
Compatible with Greenworks G-MAX 40V Li-Ion system offering a range of tools to Choose from.Avoid using solvents when cleaning plastic part
Brushless motor delivers up to 30% more torque for the greatest cutting performance; oil tank: translucent
Brushless motor design offers up to 70% less vibration for user comfort while working. One battery powers more than 25 tools. Battery capacity
Chain brake and low kickback chain for increased user safety. Electronic chain brake prevents from accidental kick-backs.Saw Pitch:0.375 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,767 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
